_metadata.description: State-by-state utility knowledge base. Guides AI decisions AND identifies data gaps.
purpose: 1. Tell AI what utility structures exist in each state

landscape.description: Alabama Power (IOU) dominates, plus TVA distributors in north and rural co-ops
landscape.key_insight: Northern Alabama is TVA territory - cities like Huntsville have municipal utilities that buy from TVA, not Alabama Power. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Birmingham suburbs: Alabama Power / co-ops (Rural areas around Birmingham served by co-ops); Huntsville area: TVA distributors / Alabama Power (Huntsville Utilities vs Alabama Power in suburbs)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Spire (formerly Alagasco) is the dominant provider
landscape.key_insight: Rural areas often have no piped gas - propane is common

landscape.description: Municipal utilities in cities, water authorities in counties
Isolated grids due to geography. Multiple utilities serve different regions.
landscape.key_insight: Alaska has no interconnected grid. Each region has its own utility. Co-ops dominate.

landscape.description: ENSTAR is the main gas utility in Southcentral Alaska
landscape.key_insight: Most of Alaska has no piped natural gas - heating oil and propane are common

landscape.description: Municipal utilities in cities, many rural areas have wells or village systems
Entergy Arkansas dominates, plus SWEPCO in northwest and many rural co-ops
landscape.key_insight: Northwest Arkansas (Walmart country) is SWEPCO territory, not Entergy. This is a common mistake.

landscape.description: CenterPoint Energy and Black Hills Energy are main providers
Municipal utilities and rural water associations
Xcel Energy dominates Front Range, rural co-ops elsewhere
landscape.key_insight: Denver metro: Xcel serves Denver city and close-in suburbs. United Power serves north (Brighton, Erie, Firestone - roughly north of 120th Ave). IREA serves south (Castle Rock, Parker - roughly south of Arapahoe Rd/E-470).
landscape.boundary_notes: Denver metro: Xcel serves Denver city and close-in suburbs. United Power serves north (Brighton, Erie, Firestone - roughly north of 120th Ave). IREA serves south (Castle Rock, Parker - roughly south of Arapahoe Rd/E-470).

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Xcel Energy provides gas along Front Range, Black Hills in south
Municipal utilities and special districts, water rights are complex
landscape.key_insight: Water districts in Colorado suburbs can be complex - many special metro districts

landscape.description: Eversource dominates, UI serves southwest

major_players.name: United Illuminating (UI)
major_players.coverage: Greater New Haven and Bridgeport areas

landscape.key_insight: Connecticut is deregulated - Eversource/UI handle delivery, customers can choose retail suppliers. Report the distribution utility.

landscape.description: Multiple gas utilities by region
Regional water authorities and municipal utilities
Delmarva Power serves most of the state

major_players.name: Delaware Electric Cooperative
major_players.coverage: Kent and Sussex counties rural areas

landscape.key_insight: Delaware Electric Cooperative serves rural areas in southern Delaware - don't assume Delmarva for all addresses.

landscape.description: Delmarva Power and Chesapeake Utilities
Municipal utilities and Artesian Water

major_players.name: Artesian Water
major_players.coverage: New Castle County and other areas

landscape.description: Mix of large IOU (Georgia Power) and 41 rural EMCs (Electric Membership Corporations)

major_players.name: Georgia Power
major_players.coverage: Urban/suburban Atlanta metro and major cities

landscape.key_insight: Atlanta: Georgia Power serves Fulton/DeKalb core. Jackson EMC serves Gwinnett (east of I-85), Barrow, Hall counties. Cobb EMC serves Cobb County (Marietta area). Walton EMC serves Walton County (east). Boundary roughly follows county lines but not exactly.
landscape.boundary_notes: Atlanta: Georgia Power serves Fulton/DeKalb core. Jackson EMC serves Gwinnett (east of I-85), Barrow, Hall counties. Cobb EMC serves Cobb County (Marietta area). Walton EMC serves Walton County (east). Boundary roughly follows county lines but not exactly.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

data_sources_to_acquire.name: Georgia EMC Association
data_sources_to_acquire.data_type: Member EMC list with service areas

landscape.description: Atlanta Gas Light is primary provider, some areas have no piped gas

major_players.name: Atlanta Gas Light
major_players.coverage: Most of metro Atlanta and urban areas

landscape.key_insight: Rural areas often have no piped natural gas - propane is common

landscape.description: Highly fragmented - county water authorities, city utilities, private companies
landscape.key_insight: Water is very local - need county-level data

landscape.description: Deregulated retail market in ERCOT. TDUs handle delivery, REPs handle retail. Outside ERCOT: traditional utilities and co-ops.

major_players.name: Rural Co-ops
major_players.coverage: Rural areas, some not in ERCOT

landscape.key_insight: Dallas: Oncor serves Dallas, most of Collin County (Plano, McKinney). CoServ serves Denton County (Frisco west of DNT, Flower Mound, Lewisville). Boundary roughly follows Denton/Collin county line but CoServ extends into parts of Collin. Houston: CenterPoint serves Harris County core, co-ops serve Fort Bend, Brazoria outer areas.
landscape.boundary_notes: Dallas: Oncor serves Dallas, most of Collin County (Plano, McKinney). CoServ serves Denton County (Frisco west of DNT, Flower Mound, Lewisville). Boundary roughly follows Denton/Collin county line but CoServ extends into parts of Collin. Houston: CenterPoint serves Harris County core, co-ops serve Fort Bend, Brazoria outer areas.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

data_sources_to_acquire.name: PUCT
data_sources_to_acquire.data_type: Official TDU and retail provider data

landscape.description: Regulated market. Major providers by region.
landscape.key_insight: Gas is regulated (not deregulated like electric). Provider depends on location.

landscape.description: Extremely fragmented. 1000+ MUDs, city utilities, water districts, private companies.
landscape.key_insight: MUDs are created for development financing but cities often take over service after annexation. TCEQ MUD boundaries may be stale.

missing: Accurate 'who actually serves' data - MUD vs city

data_sources_to_acquire.name: TCEQ
data_sources_to_acquire.data_type: Water district boundaries (have it, but stale)

landscape.description: Three large IOUs dominate, plus municipal utilities in major cities

major_players.name: SCE (Southern California Edison)
major_players.coverage: Southern California except San Diego and LA city

landscape.key_insight: Sacramento: SMUD serves Sacramento County (boundary is county line). LA area: LADWP serves LA city limits; Burbank, Glendale, Pasadena have own utilities within their city limits; SCE serves unincorporated areas and other cities.
landscape.boundary_notes: Sacramento: SMUD serves Sacramento County (boundary is county line). LA area: LADWP serves LA city limits; Burbank, Glendale, Pasadena have own utilities within their city limits; SCE serves unincorporated areas and other cities.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: SoCalGas dominates south, PG&E provides gas in north
Extremely fragmented - hundreds of water districts, municipal utilities, private companies
landscape.key_insight: Water is very local. Many small districts and private companies.

landscape.description: FPL dominates, plus Duke, TECO, and municipal utilities
landscape.key_insight: Tampa Bay: TECO serves Hillsborough County (Tampa), Duke serves Pinellas County (St. Pete, Clearwater). Boundary is roughly the bay/county line. Orlando: OUC serves within Orlando city limits, Duke/co-ops serve Orange County outside city.
landscape.boundary_notes: Tampa Bay: TECO serves Hillsborough County (Tampa), Duke serves Pinellas County (St. Pete, Clearwater). Boundary is roughly the bay/county line. Orlando: OUC serves within Orlando city limits, Duke/co-ops serve Orange County outside city.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Limited piped gas coverage. TECO Peoples Gas and Florida City Gas are main providers.
landscape.key_insight: Many areas have no piped natural gas - propane is common in rural/suburban areas

landscape.description: Mostly municipal utilities, some county utilities
APS and SRP split Phoenix metro, TEP serves Tucson

major_players.name: APS (Arizona Public Service)
major_players.coverage: Most of Arizona, Phoenix west side

landscape.key_insight: Phoenix metro is split: SRP serves east of ~19th Ave (Tempe, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, east Phoenix, Scottsdale). APS serves west Phoenix, Glendale, Peoria, Surprise, Avondale. Boundary roughly follows 19th Ave in central Phoenix, Agua Fria River in west valley.
landscape.boundary_notes: Phoenix metro is split: SRP serves east of ~19th Ave (Tempe, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, east Phoenix, Scottsdale). APS serves west Phoenix, Glendale, Peoria, Surprise, Avondale. Boundary roughly follows 19th Ave in central Phoenix, Agua Fria River in west valley.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Southwest Gas serves most of the state
City utilities in incorporated areas, private companies in unincorporated areas
landscape.key_insight: Many private water companies in unincorporated Maricopa County

landscape.description: Deregulated retail market. PECO, PPL, Duquesne are main distribution utilities.

major_players.name: PECO
major_players.coverage: Philadelphia area (electric only in Philly proper)

landscape.key_insight: Philadelphia: PECO serves Philadelphia and most of surrounding counties. PPL serves Lehigh Valley (Allentown, Bethlehem). Met-Ed serves Berks County (Reading). Boundaries follow county lines mostly.
landscape.boundary_notes: Philadelphia: PECO serves Philadelphia and most of surrounding counties. PPL serves Lehigh Valley (Allentown, Bethlehem). Met-Ed serves Berks County (Reading). Boundaries follow county lines mostly.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: PECO provides gas in suburbs but NOT Philadelphia city. PGW serves Philly.
landscape.key_insight: CRITICAL: PECO is electric-only in Philadelphia city. PGW is the gas utility for Philly. This is a common point of confusion.

landscape.description: Municipal utilities in cities, Pennsylvania American Water in many areas
Hawaiian Electric serves most islands, Kauai has its own cooperative
landscape.key_insight: Each island has its own grid. HECO/MECO/HELCO are all under Hawaiian Electric Industries. Kauai is separate (KIUC).

landscape.description: Hawaii Gas provides propane/synthetic gas, no natural gas pipelines

major_players.name: Hawaii Gas
major_players.coverage: Oahu and parts of other islands

landscape.key_insight: Hawaii has no natural gas - Hawaii Gas provides synthetic natural gas and propane

landscape.description: County water departments serve each island
Idaho Power dominates south, Avista in north, plus co-ops
landscape.key_insight: Idaho is split - Idaho Power in south, Avista in north (Coeur d'Alene area), Rocky Mountain Power in east.

landscape.description: Intermountain Gas serves most of the state
Municipal utilities and private water companies
ComEd dominates northern Illinois, Ameren in central/south
landscape.key_insight: Illinois is deregulated - ComEd/Ameren handle delivery. Chicago city gas is Peoples Gas, suburbs are Nicor Gas. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Chicago suburbs: ComEd / municipal (Some suburbs have municipal utilities); Springfield: CWLP / Ameren (City Water Light & Power vs Ameren in suburbs)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Nicor Gas in north suburbs, Peoples Gas in Chicago city
landscape.key_insight: CRITICAL: Chicago city is Peoples Gas, suburbs are Nicor Gas - this is a key distinction.

landscape.description: Chicago DWM and municipal utilities
Multiple IOUs serve different regions
landscape.key_insight: Indianapolis: AES Indiana serves Marion County core and downtown. Duke Energy serves surrounding counties and parts of Marion County (west/south). Boundary is complex within Marion County - roughly west of I-465 on south side is Duke.
landscape.boundary_notes: Indianapolis: AES Indiana serves Marion County core and downtown. Duke Energy serves surrounding counties and parts of Marion County (west/south). Boundary is complex within Marion County - roughly west of I-465 on south side is Duke.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: CenterPoint Energy and NIPSCO
Citizens Water in Indianapolis
MidAmerican and Alliant Energy split the state, plus many municipal utilities

major_players.name: MidAmerican Energy
major_players.coverage: Western and central Iowa including Des Moines

landscape.key_insight: Iowa has 135 municipal utilities - don't assume IOU for all cities. Ames, Muscatine, Cedar Falls have their own utilities.

landscape.description: MidAmerican and Black Hills Energy
Municipal utilities serve most cities
Evergy dominates eastern Kansas, co-ops in west

major_players.name: Evergy
major_players.coverage: Eastern Kansas including Kansas City, Topeka, Wichita

landscape.key_insight: Western Kansas has many co-ops and municipal utilities. Evergy dominates the eastern population centers.

landscape.description: Kansas Gas Service (ONE Gas)
WaterOne in Johnson County, municipal utilities elsewhere
LG&E/KU in central, Duke in north, TVA distributors in west
landscape.key_insight: Kentucky is complex - different utilities in each region. Western KY is TVA territory, northern KY is Duke. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Louisville suburbs: LG&E / co-ops (Salt River Electric, Shelby Energy in suburbs); Lexington suburbs: Kentucky Utilities / co-ops (Blue Grass Energy, Clark Energy in suburbs)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: LG&E in Louisville, Duke in north
Louisville Water Company and Kentucky American Water
Entergy Louisiana dominates, plus SWEPCO in northwest

major_players.name: Entergy Louisiana
major_players.coverage: Most of Louisiana including New Orleans, Baton Rouge

landscape.key_insight: Shreveport area is SWEPCO, not Entergy. Cleco serves central Louisiana around Alexandria.

landscape.description: Entergy and Atmos Energy
Sewerage & Water Board in New Orleans
Central Maine Power dominates, Versant in north
landscape.key_insight: Maine is deregulated - CMP/Versant handle delivery, customers can choose retail suppliers.

landscape.description: Limited natural gas - heating oil and propane common
landscape.key_insight: Most of Maine has no piped natural gas

landscape.description: Portland Water District and municipal utilities
BGE in Baltimore, Pepco in DC suburbs, others in rural areas
landscape.key_insight: Maryland is deregulated. DC suburbs are Pepco, Baltimore area is BGE. SMECO serves southern Maryland.

landscape.description: BGE in Baltimore, Washington Gas in DC suburbs
WSSC Water in DC suburbs, Baltimore City DPW
National Grid and Eversource dominate, plus 40 municipal utilities
landscape.key_insight: Massachusetts is deregulated. Many towns have municipal utilities - check before assuming National Grid or Eversource. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Boston suburbs: National Grid / Eversource / municipal (40+ municipal utilities in MA); Braintree, Wellesley, etc.: Municipal utilities (Many towns have own electric)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: National Grid and Eversource provide gas
MWRA supplies Boston area wholesale, municipal utilities retail
DTE and Consumers Energy split the state

major_players.name: Consumers Energy
major_players.coverage: Most of Lower Peninsula except southeast

landscape.key_insight: Detroit metro: DTE serves Wayne, Oakland, Macomb counties (Detroit, most suburbs). Consumers Energy serves Washtenaw (Ann Arbor), Livingston, western Oakland. Boundary roughly runs through western Oakland County.
landscape.boundary_notes: Detroit metro: DTE serves Wayne, Oakland, Macomb counties (Detroit, most suburbs). Consumers Energy serves Washtenaw (Ann Arbor), Livingston, western Oakland. Boundary roughly runs through western Oakland County.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: DTE and Consumers Energy provide gas in their electric territories
Great Lakes Water Authority in Detroit area
Xcel Energy dominates Twin Cities, co-ops and municipals elsewhere

major_players.name: Xcel Energy
major_players.coverage: Twin Cities metro and southern Minnesota

landscape.key_insight: Twin Cities: Xcel serves Minneapolis, St. Paul, close-in suburbs. Dakota Electric serves south suburbs (Eagan, Apple Valley, Burnsville - south of I-494). Connexus serves Anoka County north. Wright-Hennepin serves west.
landscape.boundary_notes: Twin Cities: Xcel serves Minneapolis, St. Paul, close-in suburbs. Dakota Electric serves south suburbs (Eagan, Apple Valley, Burnsville - south of I-494). Connexus serves Anoka County north. Wright-Hennepin serves west.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: CenterPoint Energy and Xcel Energy
Municipal utilities serve most cities
Entergy Mississippi dominates, plus TVA in northeast
landscape.key_insight: Northeast Mississippi (Tupelo, Columbus) is TVA territory, not Entergy. Gulf Coast is Mississippi Power.

landscape.description: Atmos Energy and CenterPoint Energy
landscape.key_insight: Rural areas often have no piped gas

landscape.description: Municipal utilities and rural water associations
Ameren and Evergy split the state
landscape.key_insight: St. Louis is Ameren, Kansas City is Evergy. Springfield has its own municipal utility (City Utilities). | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: St. Louis suburbs: Ameren / co-ops (Co-ops serve outer suburbs); Kansas City suburbs: Evergy / co-ops (Co-ops in rural areas)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Spire Missouri dominates
Missouri American Water and municipal utilities
NorthWestern Energy dominates, plus co-ops
landscape.key_insight: Montana is deregulated for large customers. NorthWestern serves most residential customers.

landscape.description: NorthWestern Energy in urban areas
landscape.key_insight: Rural Montana often has no piped gas

landscape.description: Municipal utilities in cities
Nebraska is 100% public power - no IOUs
landscape.key_insight: Nebraska is unique - entirely public power, no investor-owned utilities. OPPD serves Omaha, LES serves Lincoln.

landscape.description: Black Hills Energy
MUD in Omaha, Lincoln Water System
NV Energy serves most of the state

major_players.name: NV Energy
major_players.coverage: Las Vegas and Reno areas, most of Nevada

landscape.key_insight: NV Energy serves both Las Vegas (Nevada Power) and Reno (Sierra Pacific) - same company, different divisions.

landscape.description: Southwest Gas serves urban areas
Las Vegas Valley Water District and Truckee Meadows Water Authority
Eversource dominates, plus Liberty and co-ops
landscape.key_insight: New Hampshire is deregulated - distribution utilities handle delivery, customers can choose retail suppliers.

landscape.description: Limited coverage
landscape.key_insight: Much of NH has no piped gas - propane and heating oil common

landscape.description: Manchester Water Works and Pennichuck Water
PSE&G dominates north/central, JCP&L in central, ACE in south
landscape.key_insight: New Jersey is deregulated. PSE&G serves Newark/Jersey City, JCP&L serves shore areas, ACE serves south. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Central NJ: PSE&G / JCP&L (Boundary runs through Middlesex, Monmouth counties)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: PSE&G, New Jersey Natural Gas, South Jersey Gas
New Jersey American Water and municipal utilities
PNM dominates, plus El Paso Electric in south

major_players.name: El Paso Electric
major_players.coverage: Las Cruces and southern New Mexico

landscape.key_insight: Albuquerque is PNM, Las Cruces is El Paso Electric, eastern NM is Xcel (SPS).

landscape.description: New Mexico Gas Company serves most urban areas
Albuquerque Bernalillo County Water Utility Authority
Con Edison in NYC, National Grid upstate, PSEG Long Island

major_players.name: National Grid
major_players.coverage: Upstate New York including Buffalo, Syracuse, Albany

landscape.key_insight: New York is deregulated. Con Edison serves NYC, PSEG Long Island serves LI, National Grid serves upstate. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Long Island: PSEG LI only (No split - PSEG LI serves all); Westchester: Con Edison / NYSEG (Northern Westchester is NYSEG)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Con Edison in Manhattan/Bronx, National Grid in Brooklyn/Staten Island/upstate
landscape.key_insight: Gas service in NYC varies by borough

landscape.description: NYC DEP in city, municipal utilities elsewhere
Duke Energy dominates, plus Dominion in northeast and 26 rural electric cooperatives

major_players.name: Wake Electric Membership Corporation
major_players.coverage: Parts of Wake, Franklin, Durham, Granville, Nash counties

major_players.name: Piedmont Electric
major_players.coverage: Parts of Orange, Durham, Caswell, Person, Alamance counties

landscape.key_insight: Triangle: Duke serves Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill cores. Wake Electric serves northeast Wake County (Wake Forest east of Capital Blvd, Rolesville, Zebulon). Piedmont Electric serves Orange/Durham county rural areas. Boundary doesn't follow city limits.
landscape.boundary_notes: Triangle: Duke serves Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill cores. Wake Electric serves northeast Wake County (Wake Forest east of Capital Blvd, Rolesville, Zebulon). Piedmont Electric serves Orange/Durham county rural areas. Boundary doesn't follow city limits.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Piedmont Natural Gas and Enbridge Gas NC (formerly PSNC Energy/Dominion) are main providers

major_players.name: Enbridge Gas North Carolina
major_players.coverage: Triangle area, eastern NC (formerly PSNC Energy)

landscape.key_insight: PSNC Energy rebranded to Enbridge Gas NC. Wake Forest area is served by Enbridge Gas NC, not Piedmont.

landscape.description: Charlotte Water, Raleigh Water, municipal utilities
Multiple utilities serve different regions
landscape.key_insight: Fargo is Xcel, Bismarck is MDU. Many rural areas served by co-ops.

landscape.description: Montana-Dakota Utilities and Xcel Energy
Municipal utilities
Multiple IOUs serve different regions
landscape.key_insight: Columbus: AEP serves Franklin County core. South Central Power serves Pickaway, Fairfield counties (south of I-270). Consolidated Cooperative serves Delaware County (north of I-270). Boundaries roughly follow county lines.
landscape.boundary_notes: Columbus: AEP serves Franklin County core. South Central Power serves Pickaway, Fairfield counties (south of I-270). Consolidated Cooperative serves Delaware County (north of I-270). Boundaries roughly follow county lines.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Columbia Gas, Duke Energy, Dominion Energy by region
Cleveland Water, Columbus Water, Cincinnati Water Works
OG&E and PSO split the state
landscape.key_insight: Oklahoma City is OG&E, Tulsa is PSO. Many rural areas served by co-ops.

landscape.description: Oklahoma Natural Gas (ONE Gas)
Oklahoma City Utilities, Tulsa Water
PGE and Pacific Power split the state, including within Portland city limits

major_players.name: Portland General Electric (PGE)
major_players.coverage: Most of Portland metro and northwest Oregon

major_players.name: Pacific Power (PacifiCorp)
major_players.coverage: Parts of NE/SE Portland, southern and eastern Oregon

landscape.key_insight: Portland: PGE serves most of Portland west of ~42nd Ave. Pacific Power serves NE Portland east of ~42nd Ave, parts of SE Portland east of 82nd Ave, and Gresham. Boundary runs roughly north-south through east Portland.
landscape.boundary_notes: Portland: PGE serves most of Portland west of ~42nd Ave. Pacific Power serves NE Portland east of ~42nd Ave, parts of SE Portland east of 82nd Ave, and Gresham. Boundary runs roughly north-south through east Portland.

missing: Precise PGE/Pacific Power boundary within Portland
Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: NW Natural dominates western Oregon
Portland Water Bureau and municipal utilities
Rhode Island Energy serves the entire state
landscape.key_insight: Rhode Island Energy (PPL) serves essentially the entire state. Simple utility landscape.

landscape.description: Rhode Island Energy provides gas
Providence Water and municipal utilities
Duke Energy and Dominion split the state

major_players.name: Dominion Energy SC
major_players.coverage: Lowcountry and Midlands including Charleston, Columbia

landscape.key_insight: Charleston and Columbia are Dominion, Greenville/Spartanburg are Duke. Santee Cooper is state-owned. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Columbia suburbs: Dominion / co-ops (Mid-Carolina Electric, Newberry Electric in suburbs); Charleston suburbs: Dominion / Berkeley Electric (Berkeley Electric co-op in north)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Dominion Energy and Piedmont Natural Gas
Charleston Water System, Columbia Water, Greenville Water
Multiple utilities serve different regions

major_players.name: Black Hills Energy
major_players.coverage: Rapid City and western South Dakota

landscape.key_insight: Sioux Falls is Xcel, Rapid City is Black Hills Energy.

landscape.description: NorthWestern Energy and Black Hills Energy
Municipal utilities
TVA territory - all power comes from TVA, distributed by local utilities
landscape.key_insight: Tennessee is 100% TVA territory. Local municipal utilities and co-ops distribute power. No IOUs. | SPLIT-UTILITY CITIES: Nashville suburbs: NES / Middle TN EMC (MTEMC serves Williamson, Rutherford counties); Memphis suburbs: MLGW / Southwest TN EMC (Co-op serves DeSoto County MS suburbs)

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Piedmont Natural Gas in Nashville area, MLGW in Memphis
Municipal utilities - Nashville Water, MLGW, KUB
Rocky Mountain Power dominates

major_players.name: Rocky Mountain Power
major_players.coverage: Most of Utah including Salt Lake City

landscape.key_insight: Rocky Mountain Power (PacifiCorp) serves most of Utah. Some municipal utilities exist.

landscape.description: Dominion Energy Utah
Salt Lake City Public Utilities and municipal utilities
Green Mountain Power dominates
landscape.key_insight: Green Mountain Power serves about 75% of Vermont. Burlington has its own municipal utility.

landscape.description: Vermont Gas Systems serves limited areas
landscape.key_insight: Most of Vermont has no piped gas

landscape.description: Municipal utilities
Dominion Energy dominates, Appalachian Power in southwest

major_players.name: Dominion Energy Virginia
major_players.coverage: Most of Virginia including Richmond, Norfolk, Northern Virginia

landscape.key_insight: NoVA: Dominion serves Arlington, Alexandria, Fairfax close-in. NOVEC serves Loudoun County (Ashburn, Leesburg), Prince William outer areas (Gainesville, Haymarket). Boundary roughly follows Fairfax/Loudoun county line and outer Prince William.
landscape.boundary_notes: NoVA: Dominion serves Arlington, Alexandria, Fairfax close-in. NOVEC serves Loudoun County (Ashburn, Leesburg), Prince William outer areas (Gainesville, Haymarket). Boundary roughly follows Fairfax/Loudoun county line and outer Prince William.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Washington Gas in Northern Virginia, Dominion elsewhere
Fairfax Water, municipal utilities
Puget Sound Energy in west, Avista in east, plus many PUDs
landscape.key_insight: Seattle: Seattle City Light serves Seattle city limits only. PSE serves everything outside Seattle city limits (Bellevue, Redmond, Kent, Renton, etc.). Tacoma: Tacoma Power serves Tacoma city limits, PSE serves Pierce County outside. Boundary is city limits.
landscape.boundary_notes: Seattle: Seattle City Light serves Seattle city limits only. PSE serves everything outside Seattle city limits (Bellevue, Redmond, Kent, Renton, etc.). Tacoma: Tacoma Power serves Tacoma city limits, PSE serves Pierce County outside. Boundary is city limits.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: Puget Sound Energy in west, Avista in east
Seattle Public Utilities, Tacoma Water, municipal utilities
Multiple utilities serve different regions
landscape.key_insight: West Virginia is split between Appalachian Power (south) and FirstEnergy companies (north).

landscape.description: Dominion Energy and Hope Gas
West Virginia American Water and municipal utilities
We Energies in southeast, Alliant and Xcel elsewhere
landscape.key_insight: Milwaukee: We Energies serves Milwaukee County and most of SE Wisconsin. Alliant serves Dane County (Madison). Boundary roughly follows county lines. Madison: MGE serves city of Madison, Alliant serves surrounding Dane County.
landscape.boundary_notes: Milwaukee: We Energies serves Milwaukee County and most of SE Wisconsin. Alliant serves Dane County (Madison). Boundary roughly follows county lines. Madison: MGE serves city of Madison, Alliant serves surrounding Dane County.

missing: Co-op/IOU boundary precision in split cities

landscape.description: We Energies in southeast, others elsewhere
Milwaukee Water Works and municipal utilities
Rocky Mountain Power and Black Hills Energy
landscape.key_insight: Rocky Mountain Power serves most of Wyoming. Cheyenne is Black Hills Energy.

landscape.description: Black Hills Energy and Dominion Energy
Municipal utilities
Pepco serves all of DC
landscape.key_insight: Pepco is the sole electric utility for DC. DC is deregulated - customers can choose retail suppliers.

landscape.description: Washington Gas serves all of DC
DC Water serves all of DC

_template._comment: Use this template when adding new states
